subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Colt Brennan rallied No. 16 Hawaii from 14 points down in the final four minutes by scoring the tying touchdown on a 2-yard run with 31 seconds left in regulation, then threw an 8-yard scoring pass to Jason Rivers on the first possession of overtime to give the Warriors a 42-35 victory over visiting San Jose State last night. The victory for Hawaii (7-0, 4-0 Western Athletic Conference) was not sealed until Myron Newberry intercepted Adam Tafralis’s pass in the end zone on the first drive of overtime for the Spartans (3-4, 2-1). Brennan completed 44 of his WAC-record 74 passes for 545 yards and 4 touchdowns.
